intro: Pericampylus omeiensis, commonly known as the Omei mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Sichuan, China. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in summer. The plant features palmately lobed leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in montane forests. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
